I bring my experience and expertise in science, in research, and in education to each of these facets. 
Variety is the spice of life, after all. Do you have any unusual combinations of skills and roles in what you do? 7/.

#SquigglyCareer

*Supported Early Career Teachers in looking at assessment and talk for learning
*Developed a bespoke professional development session on creative ways to teach #PrimaryScience
6/

*Supported colleagues in developing training for scientists
*Organised training courses and events for scientists
*Met with teachers running post-16 journal clubs using cutting edge research to link to the curriculum
5/

This week I have: 
*Been to the zoo!
*Seen the science communicators of the future do a brilliant job sharing their scientific investigations
*Facilitated a training session with PhD students, PostDocs and Group Leaders looking at Research Integrity in practice in academia 4/

* I teach children
* I support teachers, through professional development in a variety of ways, with a variety of different hats
* I support academic research - through training and development 3/

When I worked exclusively in one field, I missed the other. That's why I cultivated roles playing to my strengths and involving both. There are essentially three components of what I do (in no particular order): 2/

I love the variety in my #PortfolioCareer
I sometimes hesitate to talk about the different aspects of my roles, but I feel they complement and support each other and I am better at each of them because of my experiences in the others. 
I love science, and I love education 1/ https://t.co/u5TJhzSyKy

@doc_kristy I always start with a new class highlighting that science is about being curious, so there are no silly questions, it's about wanting to find out more. Interestingly, I'm doing some training with postgrads currently to encourage them to ask for input from others too #ASEchat

@doc_kristy Whereas I find it much easier to digest a paragraph of information than watch a short video. I get exasperated with BBC News being full of video articles! #ShowingMyAge #ASEChat

@doc_kristy @ClaireHamnett Having strategies for where they can find information independently is helpful - we use the think, ask a friend, read the instructions (again), check equipment/resources/etc, is the information in front of you? and as a last resort - ask the teacher! #ASEchat
